org.eng.aisp.classifier.anomaly

Interface IAnomalyDetector<DATA>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATA -
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FeatureAnomalyDetector, MultidimensionalAnomalyDetector, NormalDistributionAnomalyDetector

    public interface IAnomalyDetector<DATA>
extends Serializable
    Defines an anomaly detector that can be updated with new values and determine if a given sample is anomalous based on passed updates. This is generally to be used in conjunction with classifier during calls to its train() and/or classify() methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IAnomalyDetector.AnomalyResult
      Captures data returned by isAnomaly(long, Object).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginNewDeployment()
      Signal the anomaly detector that it is being deployed in a new environment so that it may try and adapt to this new environment.
      IAnomalyDetector.AnomalyResult isAnomaly(long atTime, DATA data)
      Determines if the given data at the given time is anomalous.
      void update(boolean isOfflineTraining, boolean isNormal, long atTime, DATA data)
      Make new data readings available to the detector.

    • Method Detail

      • isAnomaly

        IAnomalyDetector.AnomalyResult isAnomaly(long atTime,
                                         DATA data)
                                  throws AISPException
        Determines if the given data at the given time is anomalous.
        Parameters:
        atTime - the time with which the data is associated. Some implementations may choose to ignore this, but it can generally be assumed that the given time is later than any times provided to update().
        data - the data to be checked for anomalous status
        Returns:
        an indication of whether the piece of data is anomalous and confidence values.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • update

        void update(boolean isOfflineTraining,
            boolean isNormal,
            long atTime,
            DATA data)
     throws AISPException
        Make new data readings available to the detector. This is generally called during initial training of the detector and may be call during operation when isAnomaly(long, Object) is being called.
        Parameters:
        isOfflineTraining - true if called prior to making any calls to isAnomaly(long, Object).
        isNormal - true if the given sample is known to be normal, otherwise the given sample is abnormal/anomalous.
        atTime - the time associated with the given data. This is generally increasing and any value should be larger than the value provided to any previous calls to this instance. Note that when isOfflineTraining is false, isAnomaly(long, Object) may have been called prior to call this method with the same value of this parameter.
        data - the data to incorporate into the model as either normal or abnormal/anomalous.
        Throws:
        AISPException

      • beginNewDeployment

        void beginNewDeployment()
        Signal the anomaly detector that it is being deployed in a new environment so that it may try and adapt to this new environment. This should restore the instance to the state prior to have been updated with online data through the update(boolean, boolean, long, Object) call.
